name: Execute Query In Snowflake
description: This node executes query in Snowflake
output: Dataframe created from the data read in from Snowflake

fields.name: authType

fields.description: Authentication Type. Possible value is OAUTH or USER_CREDENTIAL

fields.description: Warehouse for connecting to the Snowflake

fields.description: Database for connecting to the Snowflake

fields.title: Snowflake Schema
fields.description: Schema for connecting to the Snowflake

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Output Column Types
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: extraOptionsKeys
fields.title: Extra Options Keys
fields.description:
Extra options available while executing query in Snowflake. Examples:
column_mapping --> 'name' (default) or 'ordinal'. Specifies how to map columns from the Snowflake table to the DataFrame.
autopushdown --> 'on' (default) or 'off'. Enables or disables automatic query pushdown to Snowflake for optimization.
keep_column_case --> 'on' or 'off' (default). Preserves the original case of column names when set to 'on'. Converts column names to uppercase otherwise.
time_output_format --> e.g., 'HH24:MI:SS'. Defines the output format for time columns.
timestamp_output_format --> e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI:SS.FF3'. Defines the output format for timestamp columns.
fetch_size --> Number of rows to fetch per query. Adjusts the number of rows Snowflake retrieves at a time.
sftimezone --> Sets the time zone for the Snowflake session. Aligns the session with a specific time zone.
sfcompress --> 'true' (default) or 'false'. Enables or disables compression for data transfer.
sfcompresslevel --> Compression level for data transfer (e.g., 1 for fastest, 9 for best compression). Adjusts the balance between speed and compression ratio.

fields.name: extraOptionsValues
fields.title: Extra Options Values
fields.description: Config Values for the Corresponding keys
